visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a spline chart with the following specifications: Chart type: spline, Chart title: Monthly Average Temperature, Axes and labels styling: Use a dark blue color (#00008B) for the axis labels and titles, with a font size of 14px. The title should be bold and in a larger font size (20px). Data series: The data series should include monthly average temperatures for a year, with the name 'Temperature'. Custom colors: Use a gradient from light blue to dark blue for the series. Additional configurations: Set the chart background to a light gray color (#F5F5F5), add a legend at the bottom of the chart, and set the chart margins to 50 pixels on all sides.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a spline chart displaying monthly average temperatures. The chart type is set to 'spline', and the title is 'Monthly Average Temperature' with a bold, larger font size and a dark blue color. The x-axis categories represent the months of the year, and both the x-axis and y-axis labels are styled with a dark blue color and a font size of 14px. The y-axis title is also styled similarly and labeled 'Temperature (°C)'. The data series includes the monthly average temperatures with the name 'Temperature', and the series color is a gradient from light blue to dark blue. The chart background is set to a light gray color, and the legend is positioned at the bottom of the chart, centered horizontally. The chart margins are set to 50 pixels on all sides to provide adequate spacing around the chart.
